result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Artis.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 1 in each case. Remaining counts dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes.   TAD agreement proposed.  Court questioned why another diversion, if she already didn't follow through with the previous ones.  State responded.  Attorney Artis responded.  Victim notification complied with.  DA Fox recited the requirements of the TAD agreement.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the counts she plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Court questioned the defendant her understanding of the agreement.  She stated she understood the agreement and can comply with it.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered her pleas and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Finding of guilty withheld.  TAD agreement approved.  2 year agreement.  Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, with Attorney Artis.  Accepting State's offer.  Set for plea. 10/17 at 10:00 am.
of 8/2/16 motion hearing.

Exhibit 1 marked by the State.  TAD report.  Court ordered the diversion agreement revoked.  STC set for 9/12 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
